story.title: Our Story
story.para1: Founded in 2020, AJD NGANJ emerged from a grassroots movement of concerned citizens who believed that politics should serve the people, not special interests. What started as community gatherings in local halls has grown into a nationwide political force representing millions of voices.
story.para2: Our journey has been marked by unwavering commitment to democratic principles, transparent governance, and the belief that every citizen deserves a voice in shaping their nation's future. We've challenged the status quo and proven that people-powered politics can create real change.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To build a nation where every citizen has equal opportunities to prosper, where governance is transparent and accountable, and where the collective good always takes precedence over individual interests. We envision a society driven by justice, equality, and sustainable progress.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower citizens through inclusive political participation, implement policies that address real-world challenges, and create a government that truly represents and serves all people. We are committed to fighting corruption, promoting education, and ensuring economic opportunities for all.

values.title: Our Core Values
values.integrityDesc: We maintain the highest standards of honesty and ethical conduct in all our actions. Transparency isn't just a promise—it's our foundation.
values.accountabilityDesc: We are answerable to our commitments and to the people we serve.
values.inclusivityDesc: Every voice matters, regardless of background, religion, or economic status. We celebrate diversity and ensure everyone has a seat at the table.
values.innovationDesc: We embrace progressive ideas and modern solutions to age-old problems, always looking forward to build a better tomorrow.

leader1.name: Mia Moshiuzzaman
leader1.bio: The current Convenor of Aamjanata Dol is Colonel (Retd.) Mia Mashiuzzaman. He contested the first party election for the post of President and secured a landslide victory. He was elected President by receiving a total of 95 votes. His sole defeated rival was Mr. Mohammad Shoikot, who managed to receive only 3 votes. This huge margin of victory proves his strong acceptance and leadership capability within the party. He is currently leading the party as its Convenor.

leader2.name: Tarek Rahman
leader2.bio: The current General Secretary of Aamjanata Dol is Tarek Rahman. He is a well-known political figure in various popular movements across the country. He contested the first party election for General Secretary and won by a large margin. In that election, he was elected after receiving 93 votes. His sole defeated rival was Mohammad Mostofa, who received only 5 votes. He is currently managing the party's important organizational activities.

leader3.name: Jonab Arif Billah
leader3.bio: Organizational Secretary of Amjonatar Dal. He was defeated in the first election for this post. In that election, Faysal Ahmed was elected as the Organizational Secretary with 60 votes. The defeated candidates were Arif Billah (who received 34 votes) and Dr. Anamul Hoque (who received 4 votes). Subsequently, when the elected Organizational Secretary Faysal Ahmed left the party, Arif Billah was appointed as the new Organizational Secretary.

intro.title: Our Commitment to You
intro.para1: This manifesto represents more than political promises—it's a sacred contract between AJD NGANJ and the people we serve. Every policy outlined here has been developed through extensive consultation with citizens, experts, and community leaders across our nation.
intro.para2: We believe in evidence-based policymaking, sustainable development, and inclusive growth. Our vision is clear: to build a nation where opportunity is universal, where justice is blind, and where every citizen can achieve their full potential.

principles.title: Core Principles of Amjonatar Dal
principles.subtitle: The core principles of Amjonatar Dal are Sovereignty, Self-reliance, and Good Governance. These three principles will guide the structure and objectives of Amjonatar Dal. The following explanations are defined in support of the three principles:

sovereignty.title: 1. Sovereignty
sovereignty.description: Bangladesh's sovereignty means our country's independence and our ability to make our own decisions. It ensures that we will not allow foreign interference in our internal and external affairs and that our country will be governed according to our own laws and policies. By pledging to protect sovereignty, we will protect our beloved motherland from political, economic, cultural, military and social aggression.

selfReliance.title: 2. Self-reliance
selfReliance.description: We will strive to achieve self-reliance through our own resources and capabilities in Bangladesh's economic and social development. Our strong efforts will be on creating employment for the people of the country, developing local industries and increasing the ability to compete in the international market.

goodGovernance.title: 3. Good Governance
goodGovernance.description: We will fight to establish good governance through transparency, accountability and justice in running the government. Through establishing good governance, we will ensure that all activities of the state are being conducted for the welfare of the people and the rights of all levels of people are being protected.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How will these initiatives be funded?
faq.a1: Our funding strategy combines progressive taxation, efficient resource allocation, public-private partnerships, and elimination of wasteful spending. We've conducted comprehensive fiscal analysis ensuring all programs are financially sustainable without increasing the deficit.
faq.a2: Unlike traditional manifestos, ours includes specific timelines, measurable targets, and accountability mechanisms. We've committed to quarterly progress reports and independent audits to ensure transparency and track our performance.
faq.q3: How can citizens participate in implementation?
faq.a3: We believe in participatory governance. Citizens can join policy committees, attend town halls, provide feedback through digital platforms, and volunteer for community initiatives. Every voice matters in shaping our collective future.
faq.q4: What about rural and marginalized communities?
faq.a4: Special focus is given to bridging the urban-rural divide. We've allocated 40% of development funds specifically for rural areas and marginalized communities, ensuring equitable growth and opportunity for all citizens.
